meanings.definition: To mark or stain with spots or blotches.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally bespotted her shirt with ink.
meanings.sent2: The dog's fur was bespotted with mud after playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler bespotted the clean walls with colorful crayon marks.
meanings.sent4: The night sky was bespotted with twinkling stars.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully bespotted the canvas with vibrant paint strokes.

meanings.definition: To cover with spots or blemishes.
meanings.sent1: The old mirror was bespotted with tiny cracks.
meanings.sent2: The once clear pond was now bespotted with algae.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally bespotted the white cake with chocolate frosting.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation was bespotted by unfounded rumors.
meanings.sent5: The garden was bespotted with colorful flowers in full bloom.
